patterns: Hi
Hey
How are you
Is anyone there?
Hello
Good day
responses: Hello, there
Hello, thanks for visiting
Hi there, what can I do for you?
Hi there, how can I help?

patterns: Bye
See you later
Goodbye
See you
Okay bye
responses: See you later, thanks for visiting
Have a nice day
Bye! Come back again soon.

patterns: Thanks
Thank you
That's helpful
Thanks a lot!
responses: Happy to help!
Any time!
My pleasure

patterns: What can you help with?
What is your purpose?
What sort of questions can you help with?
What kind of questions should I ask?
What sort of questions?
Could you provide me with a breakdown of what you can do?
responses: I am here to help with any questions you may have about Wheatfield surgery. For example, appointment bookings, ordering repeat prescriptions and accessing medical records.

patterns: How can I get a repeat prescription?
What is the process for ordering repeat prescriptions for my children?
Prescription - what is this?
I need a repeat prescription
Request a repeat prescription
responses: If you do not have a Systmonline account, you can use fill in the form to request any repeat prescriptions from the Practice. They can send your request to a pharmacy. Please allow 2 working days before collecting your prescription.

patterns: Can I use my NHS account to order a repeat prescription?
responses: You can order a repeat prescription by logging into your account using the NHS app or NHS website. If you're asked to nominate a pharmacy, you can only nominate a high street pharmacy.You'll be able to collect your medicine in person when it's ready. Some high street pharmacies also deliver.

patterns: What is a repeat prescription?
Can you tell me about repeat prescriptions
I want to know about repeat prescriptions
responses: If you take medicine regularly you'll usually have a repeat prescription. This means you can order your medicine when you need it without having to see a GP until your next medicine review.

patterns: Do I need to see my GP to order a repeat prescription?
Do I need to see my GP to request a repeat prescription?
responses: You do not need to see a GP to order a repeat prescription. But you can ask for your medicine at the surgery if you do not want to do this online.

patterns: Can I order my prescription online?
Can I order my repeat prescription online?
How can I order my prescription online?
How can I order my repeat prescription online?
Can you tell me about online prescription services
I would like to know about online prescription services
How do I order repeat prescriptions online?
How can I get a repeat prescription online?
Prescription online
responses: You can use your Systmonline account to request any repeat prescriptions from the Practice.

patterns: How do I book an appointment?
Tell me about appointment bookings
I want to book an appointment
I would like to see a doctor
Seeing a doctor
Visting the doctor
Booking an appointment
What is the appointment booking process?
How do I see the doctor?
I need to book an appointment
Appointment booking process
responses: You can book an appointment to see your GP online, by phone or in-person, by going into the surgery and talking to the receptionist.

patterns: How do I book an appointment urgently?
How can I  book an appointment urgently?
I want to see my GP urgently
I want to book an appointment urgently
I would like to see a doctor urgently
I want to see a doctor urgently
I would like to book an appointment urgently
What is the policy for urgent appointments?
Urgently see the doctor
responses: Call the surgery if you need an urgent appointment. If the surgery is closed, call 999 if it is an emergency or 111 if you have any urgent queries

patterns: How do I cancel an appointment?
I would like to change my appointment
I would like to cancel my appointment
How do I reschedule an appointment?
How to reschedule my appointment?
How do I cancel an appointment?
Change appointment booking
Cancel appointment booking
Reschedule appointment booking
responses: You can book,cancel or change your appointment by contacting the surgery by phone or through your SystmOnline account.

patterns: How do I cancel an appointment online?
I would like to change my appointment
How do I reschedule an appointment online?
How do I book an appointment online?
Can I cancel my appointment online?
Change appointment booking online
Book appointment online
responses: You can use your SystmOnline account to book, check or cancel appointments with a healthcare professional.

patterns: What should I do if I missed my appointment?
I missed my appointment
What can I do if I missed my appointment?
Missed my appointment
responses: The first time a patient fails to attend a booked appointment we will send them a DNA (did not attend) letter reminding them that in future they must cancel appointments if they are unable to attend. After three failure to attend letters we will consider advising you to register with another surgery.

patterns: How can you access evening and weekend appointments?
I would like to book an evening appointment
I would like to book a weekend appointment
Book an evening appointment
Book a weekend appointment
responses: Appointments are now available to patients either pre-bookable and on the day from 18:30–20:00 Monday to Friday, Saturday is 8:30—12:30, with pre-booked telephone consultations available on Sunday. During bank holidays appointments will be available 8:30-12:30. If you need to see a GP or practice nurse  during Extended Access times, the appointment may not be at your registered Practice and you may be seen by a clinician from another practice.

patterns: How long will I have to wait for my appointment?
How long to book an appointment?
How long do I have to wait to book an appointment?
Waiting time to book an appointment
responses: The waiting time for an appointment can vary depending on the availability of appointments and the urgency of your condition. If you require urgent medical attention, we may be able to offer you an appointment on the same day.

patterns: Can I see a GP without an appointment?
See GP without appointment
I want to see the doctor without an appointment
See the doctor without an appointment
See GP without an appointment
responses: This is not a walk in service so patients need an appointment to be seen by a GP or Practice Nurse. Extended access appointments are in addition to normal surgery opening hours.

patterns: How can I see a specialist?
What is the process for a referral?
I need to see a specialist
How do I see a specialist?
I need a specialist referral
How can I get a specialist referral from my GP
Letter of referral
Specialist referral request
responses: A specialist will only see you with a letter of referral from your GP. The letter will give the specialist essential background information, such as your medical history, and it'll also contain details that the specialist needs to pay particular attention to.

You're entitled to ask for a referral for specialist treatment on the NHS. If you wish to be referred to a specialist in a particular field, such as a cardiologist or gynaecologist, you should complete the form on our website or see the GP directly.

patterns: What is the policy on cancelling appointments?
Cancellation policy
I want to cancel my appointment
Cancel my appointment
responses: Cancellations can be done online or over the phone. Cancellations notified less than 30 minutes before the appointment time will be recorded as failure to attend (DNA).

patterns: What are the practice's opening hours?
GP opening hours
Opening hours
What time does the practice open?
What time do you open?
Opning hours
responses: The opening hours are 8:30 am to 6:30 pm, Monday to Friday.

patterns: Who do I contact in the case of a medical emergency outside of surgery hours?
I have a medical emergency and my GP is closed who should I contact?
Medical emergency and GP is closed
Out of hours medical emergency
responses: If the surgery is closed, call 999 if it is an emergency or 111 if you have any urgent queries.

patterns: How do I make a complaint?
How to make a complain?
I had a bad experience and I want to complain
Negative experience with my GP
What is the complaints process?
How do I complain about my experience?
Where do I complain?
Where should I complain?
Where can I complain?
How can I complain about my experience at the GP?
I want to write a complaint
I want to complain
Complaints process
Complains
responses: You can either complain to the NHS service provider directly (such as a GP, dentist surgery or hospital) or to the commissioner of the services, which is the body that pays for the NHS services you use. You cannot apply to both.

patterns: Tell me about vaccinations
Can I get vaccinated at the surgery
I want to book a vaccination appointment
responses: We can provide a number of vaccinations such as the flu vaccine and some travel vaccinations.

patterns: Can I receive a flu vaccination at the surgery?
How do I get a flu vaccine?
Flu vaccination at the surgery
Can I get a flu jab at the surgery
Flu jab at GP
Flu jab
I want a flu jab
I want to book a flu jab appointment
Flu jab appointment
Book a flu jab appointment
responses: If you're eligible for a free flu vaccine, you can book an appointment for it.

patterns: Can I get travel vaccinations from my GP?
Travel vaccinations at GP
Travel vaccinations at GP surgery
Book travel vaccinations appointment
How much to get travel vaccinations at GP
How much to get travel vaccinations
responses: If you require any vaccinations relating to foreign travel, you need to make an appointment with the practice nurse to discuss your travel arrangements. This will include which countries and areas within countries that you are visiting to determine what vaccinations are required. It is important to make this initial appointment as early as possible (at least 6 weeks before you travel) as a second appointment will be required with the practice nurse to actually receive the vaccinations.

patterns: How can I access my medical records?
When will patients be automatically given access to more information added to their GP record?
What are medical records?
I want to access my medical records
Access medical records
Access my medical records
responses: Medical records hold information about you. You'll have separate records for any NHS service you go to including the surgery, hospital, dentist or opticians. Your GP record includes information like any conditions or allergies you have and any medicine you're taking. There are 3 ways to access your medical records: using your NHS account, your SystmOnline account and directly speaking to the surgery.

Most patients who use online services will automatically be given access to more information added to their GP record from November 2022 onwards, including letters, test results and appointment notes.

patterns: How can I access my medical records using my NHS account?
How do I access my medical records using my NHS account?
Access medical records using NHS account
I want to access my medical records using my NHS account
responses: You can get your GP record by logging into your account using the NHS app or NHS website. First, you need to register for online services and prove who you are. You can do this when you create an account.You'll need to ask the surgery for online access to your full record, or you'll only see your medicines and allergies.

patterns: How can I access my medical records using online services?
How do I access my medical records using online services?
Access medical records using online services
Using online services, I want to access my medical records
responses: You can use your SystmOnline account to get your GP record. First, you need to register for online services and prove who you are. You'll need to ask your GP surgery for online access to your full record, or you'll only see your medicines and allergies. Some services and apps are only available in certain areas. Ask your GP surgery which one you can use.

patterns: How do I access my test results?
How can I access my test results?
Access test results
Test results
responses: If you are registered for online service you can access your test results directly via the NHS app, otherwise you should call the Practice.

patterns: How do I register with a GP?
Is it free to register with a GP surgery in England?
Can I register with a GP?
Register with GP
responses: Anyone in England can register with a GP surgery. It's free to register. You can register by contacting the surgery and filling out a form. You do not need proof of address or immigration status, ID or an NHS number. GP surgeries are usually the first contact if you have a health problem. They can treat many conditions and give health advice. They can also refer you to other NHS services.

patterns: Can I register with a GP surgery outside the area I live?
Outside area register with a GP
Is it possible to register with a GP oustside my area
Register with a GP outside my area
responses: Yes, you can. However, we can refuse registration for reasons such as if we are not taking new patients or it's too far away from your home and you need home visits.

patterns: Are there any restrictions on registering with a GP surgery outside my area?
I want to register with a GP outside my area
Restrictions to register with a GP outside my area
responses: The surgery will decide if they can accept you as a regular patient or accept you without home visits.

patterns: Can a GP surgery refuse registration for any reasons?
What are some reasons that a GP surgery may refuse registration?
GP refused registration
GP said no to register me
responses: We can refuse registration for reasons such as if we are not taking new patients or it's too far away from your home and you need home visits.

patterns: Can a GP surgery offer home visits if I register with them from outside their area?
Home visits for outside area patient visits
Outside area home visits
GP visitng patients at home who are outside their area
responses: If you live outside of our area, the GP surgery might not be able to offer home visits. Other arrangements might be made if you are not well enough to go to the GP surgery. Contact us for further information.

patterns: How do I change my registered GP?
Can I change my registered GP?
Change registered GP
Change GP
Change GP practice
Change surgery
Change GP surgery
responses: You can change your GP surgery if you need to. This might be because: you have moved, you have had problems with your current practice, you were removed from the patient list. You should tell the GP surgery if you change address or move out of the area.

patterns: Can I receive support for managing a mental health condition?
Mental health support
I am struggling with my mental health
How can my GP provide mental health support?
GP mental health support
Mental health
responses: You can receive a mental health referral from your GP. When you talk to your GP about your mental health they'll listen, give you advice and introduce you to a mental health service they think will be most helpful to you.

patterns: What is the process for requesting a home visit?
What arrangements can be made if I am not well enough to go to the GP surgery?
I would like a home visit
How to book a home visit?
I would like to book a home visit
GP home visit
Home visit
responses: A GP will only visit you at home if they think that your medical condition requires it. A GP can also decide how urgently a visit is needed. Due to increasing demand GPs can no longer automatically visit any patient who requests a home visit. All visits must now be triaged and dealt with according to clinical need.
If you live in our area, home visits can be made.

patterns: How often should I see my GP?
Frequency of visiting my GP
responses: The frequency of your visits to your GP will depend on your individual health needs. Some people may only need to see their GP once or twice a year, while others may need more frequent check-ups.

patterns: What is the process for getting a sick note?
Sick note process
Process for sick note
responses: Sick notes are free if the employee has been ill for more than 7 days when they ask for one. The healthcare professional might charge a fee if the employee has been ill for 7 days or less.

patterns: Can my GP provide me with a sick note?
I need a sick note
I am ill and I need a sick note
responses: Yes, if you are unable to work due to illness or injury, your GP can provide you with a sick note to give to your employer. The sick note will outline the duration of your illness or injury and any limitations you may have on your ability to work.

patterns: Are online consultations available at all GP surgeries?
What is an online consultation?
Book an online consultation
Online consultation
responses: We do offer video consultations. This is where you speak to a doctor or healthcare professional using the video camera in your smartphone, tablet or computer.

patterns: How has face-to-face appointments changed due to the pandemic?
responses: Appointments may take place by phone, video, or face-to-face depending on your clinical need.

patterns: What are video consultations and who offers them?
Video consulations
What is a video consultation?
What is a GP video call?
I have a video call with my GP
Video call with GP
responses: A video call is very similar to a face-to-face appointment. You will get the same care. This is where you speak to a doctor or healthcare professional using the video camera in your smartphone, tablet or computer.

patterns: How do you prepare for a video consultation?
Video consultaion preparation
What do I need for a video consultation?
How do I prepare for a video call with my doctor?
How do I prepare for a video call with my GP?
responses: To have a video consultation you need: a smartphone, tablet or computer that allows video calling – remember to make sure your microphone and camera are switched on, an internet connection, a well-lit, quiet and private space so the GP, nurse or other health professional can see you clearly

patterns: What happens during a video consultation?
responses: If a GP, doctor or healthcare professional recommends you have a video call, you will get a text, email or letter with a date and time for the appointment. A video call is very similar to a face-to-face appointment. You will get the same care. The GP, doctor or healthcare professional will ask you questions about your health to work out the best treatment for you. You can also ask any questions you may have.

patterns: What happens if the video call does not work or you do not have a signal?
Can you rebook your appointment if the video call does not work or you do not have a signal?
responses: If your video call does not work or you do not have signal, they will try a phone call instead. If this is not possible, you will be able to rebook your appointment.

patterns: Can you ask questions during a video consultation?
responses: Yes, a video call is very similar to a face-to-face appointment. You will get the same care.

patterns: Will the GP or healthcare professional be able to prescribe medicine during a video consultation?
Prescribe medicine during a video consultation
responses: If you are prescribed any medicine, the doctor or healthcare professional will give you advice on how to take it. They may talk to you about the best way of getting your prescription.

patterns: What kind of health services can be accessed online if you are registered with a GP surgery?
Use of SystmOnline account
WHat can I use my SystmOnline account for?
responses: You can use your SystmOnline account to access some health services online, such as contacting your GP, nurse or other healthcare professional for advice and support, ordering repeat prescriptions, seeing parts of your health record, including information about medicines, vaccinations and test results, seeing communications between your GP surgery and other services, such as hospitals, and booking, checking or cancelling appointments with a GP, nurse or other healthcare professional.

patterns: What kind of information can you see on your health record through online health services?
What sort of information can I see on my health record using online health services?
What sort of information can I see on my medical record using online health services?
What kind of information can you see on your health record through online health services?
Information from online health record
responses: Through online health services (NHS App or SystmOnline account), you can see parts of your health record, including information about medicines, vaccinations, and test results, as well as communications between your GP surgery and other services such as hospitals.

patterns: What kind of healthcare professionals can you contact for advice and support through online health services?
Who can I contact through online health services?
How can I get advice through online health services?
How can I get support through online health services?
How can I get advice and support through online health services?
responses: You can contact your GP, nurse or other healthcare professional for advice and support through online health services.

patterns: How can you find out which online health service providers you can use?
How can I find out which online health service I can use?
Which online health service provider can I use?
What online health service provider is used by my GP?
I want to find out which online health service provider my GP uses
responses: To access online health services you can use your SystmOnline account or the NHS App.

patterns: How can you register to use online health services?
How can I register for online health services?
I want to register for online health services, how can I do that?
responses: To register to use online health services, you need to prove who you are. You can do this online using NHS login or by using details from your GP surgery to fill in a short registration form.

patterns: How to prove your identity to use online health services?
How do I prove my identity to use online health services?
Prove identity for online health services
responses: The two ways to prove your identity to use online health services are by proving who you are online using NHS login or by using details from your GP surgery to register.

patterns: What time should I arrive for my appointment?
When should I come for my appointment?
Arrival time for appointment
responses: You should aim to arrive at least 10 minutes before your appointment.
